intro: [WRONG START] Lysimachia vulgarus f. rubrotincta, commonly known as the red-stemmed yellow loosestrife, is a variant of the common yellow loosestrife. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its bright yellow flowers and distinctive red-tinged stems. The plant typically thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Botanically, it belongs to the Primulaceae family and is noted for its ornamental value in garden settings.
